docs.snippet: Someone else is making videos about the Oscar's; the Bagger is outraged....
docs.lead_paragraph: Some hussy from MTV makes a late grab for best Oscar-related video of 2008 and triumphs. The Bagger was left with a frozen smile on his face and a wan wave from the cheap seats.
docs.abstract: Someone else is making videos about the Oscar's; the Bagger is outraged.

docs.snippet: Maybe it's the high price of oil, but L.A., where the Bagger has just touched down, seems to be suffering from an energy crisis....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bagger, an East Coaster by residence and a Midwesterner in affect, is in Los Angeles, laying down suppressive fire in anticipation of the full-on assault on Sunday. He would like to write that the place is crackling with golden energy, but it's sorta the opposite. Even his fellow ninnies are suffering from an energy crisis.
docs.abstract: Maybe it's the high price of oil, but L.A., where the Bagger has just touched down, seems to be suffering from an energy crisis.

headline.main: L.A. is Taking This Whole Green Thing Pretty Seriously

docs.snippet: Some interesting analytics to help and/or confuse ninnies in making their picks....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hollywood Elsewhere reminded the Bagger to check in on Film Jerk's running Oscar analytics, which is a fanboy's dream, if you like a little numbers to go with yer frocks.
docs.abstract: Some interesting analytics to help and/or confuse ninnies in making their picks.

headline.main: Go Ask That Guy in Accounting

docs.snippet: Uno the beagle won, so maybe this will be the year of upsets at the Oscars, too....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sniff the air. Can you smell upset? Pete Hammond points to Herbie Hancock, the New York Giants, Barack Obama and a beagle named Uno to suggest that the conventional wisdom may get clobbered on Oscar night.
docs.abstract: Uno the beagle won, so maybe this will be the year of upsets at the Oscars, too.

docs.snippet: The people speak, giving the Oscar ninnies a lot to think about....
docs.lead_paragraph: Anne Thompson points out that the there is a significant divergence between what yer typical critic would pick to win the Oscars and what real actual people, as measured by Spock.com, think will take home the big magilla.
docs.abstract: The people speak, giving the Oscar ninnies a lot to think about.

docs.snippet: The Bagger wraps his last video; viewers cheer with relief....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bagger has another one of his amazing videos, his last of the season. His disjointed soliloquy -- how many times can a guy say "Oscar," anyway? -- is matched by a look back at a fairly disjointed season. But he does get his mitts on a real live Oscar and has something of an emotional epiphany.
docs.abstract: The Bagger wraps his last video; viewers cheer with relief.

docs.snippet: There's a movement afoot, or maybe ahead, to shampoo less often....
docs.lead_paragraph: There's a movement afoot, or maybe ahead, to shampoo less often.

headline.main: Of Course I Washed My Hair Last Year (I’m Almost Certain)
